newsitem.title: USA: Home Depot drops after expected Q3 earnings.
newsitem.headline: Home Depot drops after expected Q3 earnings.

text.p: Shares in Home Depot Inc fell five percent on Tuesday on Wall Street's disappointment with a third-quarter earnings report, even though the numbers were in line with expectations, analysts said.
"People were hoping the quarter might be better than expected," said Prudential Securities analyst Wayne Hood.
"There are two other concerns: one's the possible peaking in the housing market, and we're heading into a period now where weather could affect sales in certain parts of the market," he said.
Home Depot earlier reported third quarter earnings per share rose to 46 cents from 37 cents a year earlier.
By midday, the stock was off 2-7/8 at 53-7/8 in trading on the New York Stock Exchange.
